[From Dr Mueller Government Botanist, in reply to an application for Shrubs and Seeds for the Hospital Reserve
The Amherst Hospital served the towns of both Amherst and Talbot, Vic. before functioning as a tuberculosis sanatorium which was finally closed in the 1930s. The buildings were subsequently sold for removal or burnt in bushfires. See Aitken (1988). stating that personal application
Letter not found. The application for shrubs and seeds was read at a Committee meeting of 13 May 1862 [Minute book]. must be made.]
M's letter was referred to a committee appointed to make the necessary arrangements for receiving the shrubs and seeds for the Hospital reserve. The committee passed a vote of thanks to Thomas Fisher who had applied to and received from M the shrubs and seeds and it also stated that a practical man had to be engaged to prepare the ground and plant the shrubs. Mr Gale was subsequently appointed to do this work (Minute book, 13 May, 3 June & 1 July 1862).
